Articles.Content:
Hey everyone,

I had the free version of Kerbal for quite a while, but upgraded to the full version when it was on a sale on Steam. It's a lot more scary and confusing!

I have a question, I've downloaded Mechjeb and a tutorial on how to get into orbit around the Mun, but when I open Kerbal, the tutorial doesn't come up! It's currently in my downloads folder and I've unzipped the file. What do I need to do to get it to appear? Thanks very much.

(This is the moon tutorial I'm talking about): http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/49919-0-21-1-Moon-Travel-Tutorial-1-0-0

Hi, welcome aboard!

Sure the full version of KSP has a lot more features than the demo, but I'm sure you'll get used to them in no time. And find KSP all the more interesting while doing so.

About that tutorial, you may have noted the last version of it is for version 0.22 of KSP. It includes a .dll (a plugin) to work, and many plugins from previous versions don't work with the current version of KSP (0.23.5). If you are really interested in that, you may ask the author about an update (blizzy is very good, and always helpful).

Hi, welcome aboard!

Sure the full version of KSP has a lot more features than the demo, but I'm sure you'll get used to them in no time. And find KSP all the more interesting while doing so.

About that tutorial, you may have noted the last version of it is for version 0.22 of KSP. It includes a .dll (a plugin) to work, and many plugins from previous versions don't work with the current version of KSP (0.23.5). If you are really interested in that, you may ask the author about an update (blizzy is very good, and always helpful).

Yes, the new version is much better than the old, though a bit of a steep learning curve!

That makes sense about the tutorial. I've noticed there are a hell of a lot of mods on here, any recommendations? Also, when I download them, will they automatically install onto Kerbal?
